io.oasp.module.jpa.dataaccess.api

Class AbstractPersistenceEntity

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.oasp.module.jpa.dataaccess.api.AbstractPersistenceEntity
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    MutablePersistenceEntity<Long>, Serializable, net.sf.mmm.util.entity.api.Entity, net.sf.mmm.util.entity.api.GenericEntity<Long>, net.sf.mmm.util.entity.api.MutableGenericEntity<Long>, net.sf.mmm.util.entity.api.PersistenceEntity<Long>, net.sf.mmm.util.entity.api.RevisionedEntity<Long>, net.sf.mmm.util.lang.api.attribute.AttributeReadId<Long>
    Deprecated. 
    will be removed in a future release. In order to give OASP users more flexibility we want to stop providing an JPA entity base class in this library. Instead we provide it with our application template (oasp4j-template-server) so you can take over control of JPA annotations. If you already started with OASP in an earlier version you can simply update `ApplicationPersistenceEntity` from our current sample on github to get rid of the dependency to this class.

    @MappedSuperclass
 @Deprecated
public abstract class AbstractPersistenceEntity
extends Object
implements MutablePersistenceEntity<Long>
    Abstract base implementation of MutablePersistenceEntity with a generated primary key. In case you need a different type of key add it as extra column and make it unique.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • setRevision

        public void setRevision(Number revision)
        Deprecated. 
        Description copied from interface: MutablePersistenceEntity
        This method sets the revision of this entity.
        ATTENTION:
        This operation should only be used in specific cases and if you are aware of what you are doing as this attribute is managed by the persistence. However, for final freedom we decided to add this method to the API (e.g. to copy from transfer-object to persistent-entity and vice-versa).
        Specified by:
        setRevision in interface MutablePersistenceEntity<Long>
        Parameters:
        revision - the revision to set
